text.2_Daf, 14_Line: that whoever witnesses a suspected woman In her disgrace should withhold himself from wine.
text.2_Daf, 33_Line: We similarly learn in the Mishnah: If one witness says: I saw that she committed misconduct, she does not drink the water.
text.2_Daf, 8_Line: IF [HER HUSBAND] DIED, SHE PERFORMS THE CEREMONY OF HALIZAH BUT CANNOT CONTRACT A LEVIRATE MARRIAGE.
text.2_Daf, 3_Line: HE WARNS HER ON THE TESTIMONY OF TWO AND MAKES HER DRINK ON THE TESTIMONY OF TWO.
text.2_Daf, 34_Line: Whence is it derived according to Torah-law that one witness is believed?
text.2_Daf, 10_Line: — It is according to the view of Rabbi;
text.2_Daf, 15_Line: But [the Tanna in the Mishnah] should treat of [Tractate] Sotah first and afterwards that of Nazir!
text.2_Daf, 36_Line: And there be no witness against her — the text refers to two witnesses. But perhaps it is not so and even one [suffices]!
text.2_Daf, 29_Line: the latter dictum referring to a first marriage and the former to a second marriage.
text.2_Daf, 22_Line: Rabbah b. Bar Hanah said in the name of R. Johanan:
text.2_Daf, 32_Line: So far only do [R. Eliezer and R. Joshua] differ, viz. in the matter of warning and seclusion, but in the matter of misconduct [they agree] that one witness is believed.
text.2_Daf, 13_Line: Why does the section of the Nazirite adjoin that of the suspected woman? To tell you
text.2_Daf, 17_Line: IF ONE WARNS HIS WIFE. As an accomplished fact it is allowable, but as something still to be done it is not.
text.2_Daf, 37_Line: There is a teaching to declare, One witness shall not rise up against a man.
text.2_Daf, 16_Line: — Since he treated of [Tractate] Kethuboth [marriage-settlements] and dealt with the theme, ‘He who imposes in vow upon his wife’, he next treated of [Tractate] Nedarim [Vows]; and since he treated of [Tractate] Nedarim, he proceeded to treat of [Tractate] Nazir which is analogous to Nedarim, and then continues with Sotah for the reason given by Rabbi.
text.2_Daf, 19_Line: it is forbidden to give a warning.
text.2_Daf, 0_Line: [Mishnah]  IF ONE WARNS HIS WIFE [NOT TO ASSOCIATE WITH A CERTAIN MAN]. R. ELIEZER SAYS:
text.2_Daf, 26_Line: Forty days before the creation of a child, a Bath Kol20 issues forth and proclaims,
text.2_Daf, 20_Line: R. Samuel b. R. Isaac said: When Resh Lakish began to expound [the subject of] Sotah, he spoke thus:
text.2_Daf, 27_Line: The daughter of A is for B; the house of C is for D; the field of E is for F!
text.2_Daf, 9_Line: [Gemarah]  Now that the Tanna has finished [Tractate] Nazir, what is his reason for continuing with [Tractate] Sotah?
text.2_Daf, 23_Line: It is as difficult to pair them as was the division of the Red Sea; as it is said: God setteth the solitary in families: He bringeth out the prisoners into prosperity!(Psalms 68:7)
text.2_Daf, 25_Line: for Rab Judah has said in the name of Rab:
text.2_Daf, 6_Line: DO NOT CONVERSE WITH THAT MAN, AND SHE CONVERSED WITH HIM, SHE IS STILL PERMITTED TO HER HUSBAND AND PERMITTED TO PARTAKE OF THE HEAVE-OFFERING.
text.2_Daf, 31_Line: HE WARNS HER ON THE TESTIMONY OF TWO WITNESSES etc.
text.2_Daf, 21_Line: They only pair a woman with a man according to his deeds; as it is said: For the sceptre of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous. (Psalms 125:3)
text.2_Daf, 5_Line: IF HE SAYS TO HER IN THE PRESENCE OF TWO,
text.2_Daf, 1_Line: HE WARNS HER ON THE TESTIMONY OF TWO WITNESSES, AND MAKES HER DRINK [THE WATER OF BITTERNESS] ON THE TESTIMONY OF ONE WITNESS OR HIS PERSONAL TESTIMONY.
text.2_Daf, 7_Line: SHOULD SHE HAVE ENTERED A PRIVATE PLACE WITH HIM AND STAYED WITH HIM A TIME SUFFICIENT FOR MISCONDUCT TO HAVE OCCURRED, SHE IS FORBIDDEN TO HER HUSBAND AND FORBIDDEN TO PARTAKE OF THE HEAVE-OFFERING.
